data.description:
At Intuit, our mission is to power prosperity around the world. Every day we innovate with our flagship products - TurboTax, QuickBooks, Credit Karma, and Mailchimp. Whether you’re a consumer, self-employed, or a small business owner, we’re in your corner to help make your dreams of prosperity come true through technology that impacts the lives of millions of people.


Our Product Managers take groundbreaking products from idea to reality. They prioritize customer needs, lead agile development, and deliver delightful products and experiences to improve the lives of our customers.


Product Management Internship projects may range from building new features, solving problems for new customer segments, launching rapid experiments, and aligning product experiences across the Intuit ecosystem.


Responsibilities

Lead a cross functional team of engineers, designers, UX researchers, data analysts, data scientists, marketers, and/or customer success to create new products and features


Become an expert on the customer by gathering qualitative and quantitative data to build empathy and uncover actionable insights


Gather requirements, define experiences and use cases, develop data-backed learning plans, lead product planning and create the product roadmap


Ship product and feature improvements using rapid tests and experimentation in a fast paced environment


Apply innovative and new technologies to improve customer experiences across Intuit’s product ecosystem


Qualifications

Must be a current student enrolled in a U.S.-based, degree-seeking program (or the equivalent) and returning to school following the internship, with an expected graduation date of December 2026 or later. Relevant programs include bachelor's, master’s/MBA, and PhD students studying Business, Marketing, Computer Science, Engineering, Management Information Systems, or other field related to Product Management


Demonstrated experience in designing, building, or implementing solutions that leverage Machine Learning, AI, or automation technology


Innovative thinker with a passion for problem-solving and the ability to provide a logical framework to support conclusions and ideas


Demonstrated accountability for outcomes and ability to drive tasks to completion with decisive prioritization


Demonstrated leadership skills, teamwork, and collaboration capabilities. Ability to lead and influence a cross-functional team while building strong relationships


Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to communicate impact and rally teams behind a common goal


Demonstrated ability to adapt based on changes or new learnings


Intuit provides a competitive compensation package with a strong pay for performance rewards approach. Pay offered is based on factors such as job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and work location. To drive ongoing fair pay for employees, Intuit conducts regular comparisons across categories of ethnicity and gender. The expected base pay range for this position is:
